MAR 2 1970
Student Smoking Still Problem But School Officials Optimistic
By ROBERT SETLIK Patriot Ledger Staff Reporter
Students show signs of developing their own generation gap on the smoking issue, ac- cording to many area school administrators.

"In Norwell, the school com- mittee has been requested to give smoking privileges to students. In a number of other towns the issue is being discussed.
Even in these towns, however, giving students smoking privileges is not seen as a means of en- couraging the practice.
Furthermore, he feels the "smoke-out" had a substantial Low In Priority impact on students, and many now are less Interested in the Supt. Lawrence P. Creedon smoking issue.
